title: Carjacking suspect shot by intended victim
content:
KOB.com Web Staff
Albuquerque police say an attempted carjacker is in critical but stable condition in the hospital after his intended target fought back.
Police say officers were called to an apartment complex at Montgomery and Carlisle boulevards around 6:30 p.m. Monday. According to police, three juvenile males tried to carjack a couple in the parking lot. The driver shot at them, shooting one of the suspects in the head. The other two ran off.
The suspect who was shot has been identified as 16-year-old Gabriel Gonzales. Police said he had a robbery warrant out for his arrest and had just been released from probation for shoplifting. Police said Gonzales is connected to the violent juvenile gang that has been committing crimes around Albuquerque.
